text:
Hello everyone!

I am excited to share about Be Zen.  If you are based in the US and trying to be more sustainable/live an eco-friendly lifestyle, please try out the <https://t2m.io/chrome|Be Zen chrome extension>.

Been working on it for the past 6 months. I just launched the beta version last month and would love to get feedback on your experience with the chrome extension. Please let me know if you would be interested to <https://tidycal.com/ramchaitanya88/feedback|sign up as a test user and share your feedback> :pray:

attachments.fallback: Be Zen - Your Eco-friendly Shopping Assistant
attachments.text: Find the best ethical and affordable sustainable brands
attachments.title: Be Zen - Your Eco-friendly Shopping Assistant

attachments.fallback: TidyCal: Ram Chaitanya - Be Zen Chrome Extension Feedback | TidyCal
attachments.title: Ram Chaitanya - Be Zen Chrome Extension Feedback | TidyCal

text:
If you're hiring or managing talent, I've got two good reads for you today.

The first is about a subtle bias that may be removing your best candidates from the running without your permission. Confirmation Bias. 

According to inclusivity consultant, Dr. Pragya Agarwal, confirmation bias can lead to discrimination in the recruitment process because of preconceived ideas. 

It manifests as unconsciously looking for information that supports first impressions of a candidate’s skills. An impression unfairly influenced by anything from how the candidate looks, to whether they went to an Ivy League College, or worked at a Fortune 500 company. 

Like all biases, confirmation bias can affect your organization in several ways. It can limit diversity efforts, employee creativity, productivity, and in turn, business performance.

In fact, confirmation bias can be the foundation and enabler for several types of hiring bias. Gender bias, subgroup bias... 

Sadly, even tiny amounts of bias in the hiring process can lead to huge financial losses. Research by Oregon State University indicates that as little as 1% of gender bias in hiring can lead to 32 additional failed hires and a $2.8 million per year loss in productivity for companies that hire 8,000 new employees per year. Bump that number up to 4% and you have an additional 192 failed hires and $17 million in lost productivity.

Want to learn more about this bias and how you can nip it in the bud before it costs you big?

<https://vervoe.com/confirmation-bias-in-hiring/|https://vervoe.com/confirmation-bias-in-hiring/>

attachments.fallback: Vervoe: Confirmation Bias In Hiring And How To Avoid It | Vervoe
attachments.text: A helpful breakdown of confirmation bias in hiring and how to avoid it at your organization to make sure you're not missing great candidates.
attachments.title: Confirmation Bias In Hiring And How To Avoid It | Vervoe

text:
The second is about Groupthink. A workplace menace team leaders face. 

Some of the biggest organisations in the world have faced the brunt of it :smiling_face_with_tear:. Swissair, Kodak photography, and more recently, Pepsi. 

In 2017, Pepsi ran a Black Lives Matter ad featuring Kendall Jenner. The ad showed the white celebrity handing a Pepsi to a police officer, to quell building tension during a Black Lives Matter protest. That ad was a massive fail. The question on everyone’s lips was, “How did no one stop this?”.

There were six key people listed as credits for the advert. Is it safe to assume that all six of them thought it was a good idea? Maybe. But a more reasonable explanation would be that the team members who thought it was a bad idea stayed silent for the sake of group cohesiveness. 

They succumbed to groupthink. 

This article covers everything you need to know about groupthink. What it is, the causes, negative effects, symptoms, examples, and how to avoid it.

<https://www.betterup.com/blog/what-is-groupthink|https://www.betterup.com/blog/what-is-groupthink>

attachments.fallback: What Is Groupthink And How Do You Avoid It?
attachments.text: Groupthink can harm teams and stifle creativity. Here are some symptoms to look out for and ways to avoid it in the workplace.
attachments.title: What Is Groupthink And How Do You Avoid It?
